description: Reproducible research for 'Frequency Selective Compressed Sensing'
README.txt:
1. GENERAL INFO

This repository reproduces results from the paper "Frequency Selective Compressed Sensing".
You can download the paper from arXiv.org: http://arxiv.org/abs/1501.01792

*Author*:
    Jacek Pierzchlewski, Aalborg University, Denmark. <jap _[at]_ es.aau.dk>

*Version*:
    1.0    | 16-JAN-2015 : * Initial version.

*License*:
    BSD 2-Clause

*Pltforms*:
    Linux and Mac. Not tested on Windows.

Questions and comments are welcome. Please send to jap _[at]_ es.aau.dk

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

2. HOW TO RUN?

There are 3 main files which reproduce the results from the paper:
        Fig6.py      - reproduces figure 6. Run: $ python Fig6.py
        Fig7left.py  - reproduces figure 7, left side.  Run: $ python Fig7left.py
        Fig7right.py - reproduces figure 7, right side.  Run: $ python Fig7right.py

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

3. PATES AND RXCS

This reproducible research repository contains 2 toolboxes which are developed in the IRFDUCS project: PaTeS and RxCS.
You can read more about these toolboxes on IRFDUCS project website:

    PaTeS:   http://www.irfducs.org/pates/
    RxCS:    http://www.irfducs.org/rxcs/

Both these toolboxes are available on GitHub:

    PaTeS:    https://github.com/JacekPierzchlewski/PaTeS
    RxCS:     https://github.com/JacekPierzchlewski/rxcs


In the repository there are 2 directories with PaTeS and RxCS:

        /PaTeS-19Sep2014 - PaTeS toolbox, version from 19 September 2014
        /RxCS-15Jan2015 - RxCS toolbox, version from 15 January 2015

You can download newest versions from GitHub, both RxCS and PaTeS are backward compatible.
